item.description:
I liked the previews for Win Win, and I loved the director's earlier movies: The Station Agent and The Visitor. For an interview with the director, Tom McCarthy, go to http://www.landmarktheatres.com/letters/winwin.htm. This interview is from the website for the Kendall Square Cinema.

This link will take you to a review by Peter Travers, reviewer for Rolling Stone: http://www.rollingstone.com/movies/reviews/win-win-20110310. Here's an excerpt from Travers's review:

"Director Tom McCarthy is some kind of wizard. In his hands, simple stories (The Station Agent, The Visitor) take on the gritty texture and emotional heft of life as it's lived, not contoured by Hollywood. Win Win, which he wrote with Joe Tiboni, is McCarthy's latest gem, hilarious and heartfelt with a tough core that repels all things sappy. Paul Giamatti gives a master class in acting as Mike Flaherty, a New Jersey lawyer specializing in elder care and, lately, in cutting corners. With the economy squeezing Mike's life with wife Jackie (the ever-wondrous Amy Ryan) and their two kids, he takes on the guardianship of near-demented Leo (Burt Young) with no intention of earning his monthly fee. When Leo's junkie daughter, Cindy (Melanie Lynskey), drops in from Ohio looking for Leo's cash, Mike fights back.

Bit who’s more selfish? Mike uses Cindy's alienated son, Kyle (Alex Shaffer), to boost his case and the losing high school wrestling team he coaches with his friend Terry (a superb Bobby Cannavale). Newcomer Shaffer is an expert wrestler, and it shows; so does his natural talent. His scenes with Giamatti floor you. Nothing fancy — that's not McCarthy's style. Neither is phony rah-rah. This movie wins you over, head and heart, without cheating. It's just about perfect.”

 

And in addition to all that, it’s a Bobby Cannavale movie! Cannavale may not get top billing, but he’s another good reason to see this movie as far as I'm concerned.

The movie starts at 4:00 p.m. I'll buy my ticket at 3:30 p.m. and wait in the theater lobby by the bottom of the staircase for about 15, maybe 20 minutes. Look for my bright red backpack. If you are late, you can find me in the auditorium watching the previews before the movie or the credits after the movie.

I'll linger a bit in the theater lobby by the staircase after the movie, too, so we can decide where to eat afterward, if that's what people would like to do. We have several options: The Friendly Toast, Emma's Pizza, among others.

See you at the Kendall!

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my bright red backpack. See the event description for more details.
item.name: Win Win at the Kendall Square Cinema
